_comments.note: This is a template for submitting ideas to /dev/ideas
_comments.instructions: 1. Copy this file to ideas/your-idea-slug.json, 2. Fill in all required fields, 3. Remove this _comments block, 4. Submit PR
_comments.guide: See CONTRIBUTING.md for detailed submission guidelines

_id_help: Lowercase, hyphens only, max 60 chars. Example: 'neural-kernel-scheduler'
title: Short Descriptive Title
_title_help: 5-100 chars. Example: 'Neural Kernel Scheduler' or 'Self-Healing WebAssembly Modules'
_status_options: experimentation - active testing with data collection
_status_note: Start with 'hypothesis' for new ideas. 'poc' and 'validated' require proofs array.

author.name: Your Full Name (optional)
author._doi_help: Optional. DOI from Zenodo/HAL if you've registered this idea. Example: '10.5281/zenodo.1234567'

content.problem: What technical problem does this address? Describe the gap or limitation. (20-500 chars)
content._problem_example: SQLite is great but doesn't replicate. CRDTs enable conflict-free sync for local-first apps.
content.approach: High-level intuition or method. How would you solve it? (20-500 chars)
content._approach_example: Wrap SQLite in a CRDT layer using automerge or yjs principles for state management.
content.why_not_bullshit: Why is this technically coherent? Constraints, edge cases, or proof of feasibility. (20-500 chars)
content._why_not_bullshit_example: SQLite's deterministic query planner + CRDT merge semantics are compatible. Prior art: ElectricSQL, CR-SQLite.

_proofs_help: Required for 'poc' or 'validated' status. Max 3 items. Remove if hypothesis/experimentation/concept.

metadata._updated_help: Same as created initially, update when making changes

_discussion_url_help: Leave as null - this will be auto-generated by GitHub Actions after merge
